meanings.definition: A platform at a railway station.
meanings.sent1: The passengers waited on the perrons for the train to arrive.
meanings.sent2: The conductor announced the departure time on the perrons.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons gathered on the perrons, waiting for any crumbs to drop.
meanings.sent4: The perrons were like islands in a sea of bustling commuters.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight bathed the perrons in a warm glow, welcoming travelers.

meanings.definition: A flight of steps leading to a building or street.
meanings.sent1: She climbed the perrons to reach the entrance of the museum.
meanings.sent2: The old library had grand perrons leading up to its doors.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat at the top of the perrons, surveying the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The perrons seemed to whisper stories of all who had ascended them.
meanings.sent5: The rain made the perrons slippery, causing a few near tumbles.
